title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Thursday, 24 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: fourteen people are injured after a bus crashes into a building on broadway , peterborough .
a man is taken to hospital with 50 % burns after a suspected gas explosion in gamlingay .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on tuesday 29 december .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: goodbye from the cambridgeshire live team on christmas eve we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday 29 december with more news , sport , travel and weather .
join us then .
if you have any photographs from around the county that you 'd like to share , or if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about , you can contact us viaemail , facebookortwitter .

documents.title: man arrested after assault in brampton in early hours
text: a 29-year-old man from northamptonshire has been arrested on sus of wounding with intent to cause gbh after an alleged attack in cambridgeshire .
police were called at 02:26 by the ambulance service to reports of an assault in brampton high street .
the arrested man is from wellingborough and the victim , a man in his 20s , received serious but not life threatening injuries - he is now recovering at home , police said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: 'car pushing bus ' blamed for crash in peterborough
text: a bus company has said a car crashed into a bus , which then went into the front of the guide dogs for the blind association building on broadway in peterborough .
`` initial reports suggest that the collision has resulted in the bus being pushed into a building , '' a spokesman for bus operator stagecoach said .
`` our first thoughts are for the welfare of those involved .
safety is our highest priority and we will assist police fully with their inquiries into the incident . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: two people were in house blasted by gas explosion
text: two people , a husband and wife still not named officially , were in a house in gamlingay severely damaged by a gas explosion early on christmas eve .
neighbour cherry balf said she was woken at 05:30 by the loud blast , and looking out of a landing window she saw debris on the lawn and green opposite where she lived .

her next-door neighbour was talking to someone else from green acres where the explosion took place and his wife was wandering around `` in a daze from shock '' but emergency services arrived very quickly , she said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : showers die out to leave good clear intervals
text: lingering showers will soon die out with some good clear intervals developing .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: guide dogs branch staff 'safe after bus and car crash '
text: major structural damage was caused to a building housing the local branch of the guide dogs for the blind association in broadway , peterborough , when a bus and car crashed earlier today .
`` three members of staff , .
but no guide dogs were inside , '' a spokesman said .
`` immediate action was taken to make sure everyone inside the building was safe and work is underway to ensure the building is made safe and secure . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: strong winds push sea sick atlantic rowers off course
text: an afghan war veteran from cambridgeshire is one of four ex-serviceman hit by severe sea sickness two days into an attempt to row across the atlantic .
paddy gallagher and the crew aim to row 3,000 miles in under 55 days in the talisker challenge and have 2,453 miles to go .
they have sent word back that two of them are suffering sea sickness as an `` extra challenge '' along with brisk winds and heavy swell constantly putting their boat off course .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: seven people taken to hospital after bus and car crash
text: seven people were taken to peterborough city hospital with a variety of minor injuries after a bus crashed into the guide dogs charity 's branch office in broadway .
the injured included a woman car driver in her 50s and a woman car passenger ; and four women and one man who were passengers on the bus .
a man and a woman were treated for minor injuries and four people were discharged at the scene , but no further information was available , east of england ambulance service said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: bus crashed into local branch of guide dogs charity
text: the building crashed into by a bus in broadway , peterborough , is a local branch office of theguide dogsundefinedcharity .
three people were inside when the bus crashed , demolishing the front wall and bay window , but none were injured .
one person is being treated in hospital and 13 others were treated at the scene following the crash .
two people were cut free from a people-carrier involved in the collision .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: two people cut free by firefighters after bus and car crash
text: two people were cut free by firefighters from a people carrier-type car that collided with a bus on broadway in peterborough at lunchtime .
the bus then crashed into a house , demolishing the garden wall and front bay window .
fire station commander jamie johnson said : `` severe damage was caused to the building as a result of the collision and a structural engineer was called to assess the damage . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: one person taken to hospital and 13 more injured in bus crash
text: one person was taken to hospital by ambulance and 13 were treated at the scene when a bus crashed into the front room of a house on broadway in peterborough at lunchtime .
a spokesman for theeast of england ambulance servicesaid the injuries were not thought to be life-threatening .
`` we dispatched five ambulance crews , a rapid response vehicle , two ambulance officers , and the magpas air ambulance , '' he added .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: front window of 100-year-old house demolished by bus
text: the whole bay front window and garden wall of a 100-year-old house on the broadway , peterborough , were demolished by a single-decker bus that came off the road at lunchtime .
a spokesman forcambridgeshire constabularysaid : `` police were called to reports of a collision between a bus and a car on broadway in peterborough at 11:43 this morning .
`` the road has been cordoned off between church walk and the broadway near to the theatre .
we advise people to avoid the area until further notice . ''

documents.title: people-carrier occupants believed trapped after bus crash
text: occupants of a people-carrier are believed to have been trapped in the vehicle after a bus came off the road in the broadway , peterborough , and crashed into house .
peterborough mayor john peach was having lunch nearby when he heard emergency service sirens and went out to investigate .
`` about 20 % of the length of the bus was embedded in the front room of a house near the crawthorne road junction and it had demolished the wall in front , '' he said .

documents.title: firefighters freeing people from car at scene of peterborough bus crash
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue has tweeted :
we 're currently extricating casualties from a car following a collision involving a # bus in # peterborough
@ twitterid keep up the great work guys .
# 24/7 working around the clock .

documents.title: breakingbus crashes into building on broadway in peterborough
text: a bus has crashed into a building on the broadway in peterborough causing part of it to collapse .
more news as we have it .

documents.title: watch : damage at the scene of gamlingay explosion
text: radio cambridgeshire reporter david webster is at the scene of the suspected gas explosion in gamlingay .
he 's tweeted this video showing damage to the house .
front of house blown out in gamlingay christmas eve gas explosion .
hear the neighbour on @ twitterid

documents.title: gamlingay explosion : elderly man found with severe burns outside house
text: firefighters were sent to gamlingay after an emergency 999 call at 05:33 today and found an elderly man with severe burns outside a house in green acres .
local fire station commander kevin napier said : `` the man sadly has suffered 50 % burns to his body .

`` if you suspect gas or a leakage in your property , vent the premises , evacuate and isolate if possible , and call the emergency services or emergency line for your gas supplier and report it immediately . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: picture : gamlingay suspected gas explosion
text: here 's another of the house at gamlingay severely damaged in an explosion at about 05:30 this morning .
cambridgeshire reporter david webster is at the scene .
we 'll have more for you shortly .

documents.title: gas leak suspected as cause of 'catastrophic ' explosion
text: an explosion that severely damaged a property in gamlingay and left an elderly man with 50 % burns is believed to have been caused by escaping gas .
fire station commander kevin napier said : `` it is believed what caused this explosion was a failure in the gas supply , which went directly to the kitchen hob .
`` we believe the gentleman switched on the light to the kitchen and an explosion took place that has caused some catastrophic damage to the house . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: elderly man treated for 50 % burns after blast report
text: firefighters called to reports of an explosion in gamlingay have treated an elderly man for burns while waiting for the magpas air ambulance .
a neighbour in green acres called 999 after hearing the blast in a nearby property .
the injured man was taken to hospital after suffering 50 % burns and the gas supply was isolated , gamlingaystation commander kevin napier said .

documents.title: amputee atlantic rowers hit by sea sickness in high winds
text: an ex-serviceman from cambridgeshire is one of a crew of four amputees attempting to row across the atlantic hit by severe sickness since setting off .
paddy gallagher , 30 , who was injured while serving with the irish guards in afghanistan , said their boat had been hit by heavy swells in strong north-easterly winds .
the group , believed to be the first all-amputee team to undertake the challenge , set off from the canary islands on 20 december .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: people begin queuing at chapel for carol service seat
text: about 200 people are already queuing to get a seat for the traditional nine lessons and carols service to be broadcast later from the chapel at king 's college in cambridge .
the christmas eve service , which has now become a tradition , will be broadcast this year to about four million people worldwide from 15:00 and will be live on the bbc world service .
famously a non-ticket event , people queue for hours - and sometimes even days - to get a seat .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: travel : congestion in cambridge
text: newmarket road a603 in both directions
elizabeth way in chesterton in both directions
milton road cambridge city-bound
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : wet and breezy but drier and brighter later
text: cloudy with a few showers at first before heavy rain and strong winds spread eastwards .
by mid-afternoon rain and wind will have cleared most places leaving behind sunny spells and the odd shower .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 54f )

documents.title: news : college traditional carols broadcast across world muslim charity helping north of england flood victims
text: these are the stories making the news in cambridgeshire today :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live coverage for cambridgeshire
text: hello and welcome to cambridgeshire live on christmas eve .
between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of cambridgeshire .
if there 's anything you wish to share with us you can contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News
